question: The Treaty of Alinagar was signed in ___?
explanation: February 9, 1757 the treaty of Alinagar (changed name of Calcutta) was signed between Robert Clive of the British East India Company and the Nawab of Bengal, Mirza Muhammad Siraj Ud Daula. According to this treaty a)All preivileges granted by Farrukshiyar were confirmed. b)All goods under the british dastak went to be duty free. c)The british were given right of making coin in Bengal. The signing of the treaty was one of the events leading up to the famous Battle of Plassey.
